Key Arguments: The major purveyors of misinformation are governments, their agencies, and mainstream media.
The legislation is needed but not for its currently intended purpose.
Main Themes: Distrust in government and mainstream media
Historical examples of misinformation by governments
Notable Quotes: Misinformation and disinformation pose a threat to the safety and wellbeing of Australians, as well as to our democracy, society and economy.
The major purveyors of misinformation are governments and their various agencies and the mainstream media.
